org.ingatan.component.image
Class ImageToolbar

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.image.ImageToolbar
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ImageToolbar
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Provides a toolbar for the image editor. Buttons events can be accessed by implementing an ImageToolbarListener and comparing the EventID with the fields of ImageToolbarEvent.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

setCurrentTool

public void setCurrentTool(int currentTool)
Sets the currently selected tool. Use the fields of this class to specify.

Parameters:
currentTool - the tool that should be set as the current tool.

getCurrentTool

public int getCurrentTool()
Gets the 'current tool'. This is the tool most recently set as the current tool. Compare with the fields of this class.

Returns:
the current tool.

addImageToolbarListener

public void addImageToolbarListener(ImageToolbarListener listener)
Adds a ImageToolbarListener to this ImageToolbar instance.

Parameters:
listener - the ImageToolbarListener to add.

removeImageToolbarListener

public boolean removeImageToolbarListener(ImageToolbarListener listener)
Removes a ImageToolbarListener from this ImageToolbar instance.

Parameters:
listener - the ImageToolbarListener to remove.
Returns:
true if the listener could be found and removed, and false otherwise.

fireButtonPress

public void fireButtonPress(int button)

setButtonSelection

public void setButtonSelection(boolean[] selected)
Sets which buttons should have a 'selected' highlight drawn to them.

Parameters:
selected - a boolean of length 23. Each member of this array represents the selection state of each toolbar button as it occurs on the toolbar. This means that the boolean at index 0 represents the state of the rectangular selection button, and index 1 the oval selection button, etc.

setOnlyButtonSelected

public void setOnlyButtonSelected(int button)
Sets all other buttons to an empty border apart from the specified button which is given a semi transparent 3px border.

Parameters:
button - the button which should have a border.

dispatchToolbarEvent

public void dispatchToolbarEvent(ImageToolbarEvent e)
Dispatch the given event to all the toolbar listeners added to this toolbar.

Parameters:
e - the ImageToolbarEvent to dispatch.
